thread.title: Kangaroo caught after going on the lam in New York
thread.title_full: Kangaroo caught after going on the lam in New York | www.ajc.com

author: Cox Media Group National Content Desk
title: Kangaroo caught after going on the lam in New York
text:
Urim Osmani was opening up his auto repair shop when he thought he saw a deer Saturday morning.
Turns out it was a kangaroo.
Buster escaped from an unlocked gate from a house in Staten Island, according to The New York Times .
“It was running around like crazy and we didn’t want it to get hit by a car,” Osmani told The New York Times .
>> Read more trending stories
Officers corralled the 3 ½ foot marsupial and he was “taken into custody without incident” after about 15 minutes, the Times reported.
Buster, a 3 and 1/2 foot tall kangaroo, was on the loose in New York Saturday morning. Photo Twitter. It looked like a lot of fun.
“To see a kangaroo jumping around,” Osmani told CBS New York . “Enjoying the freedom.”
The 121 pct. always gets its man...I mean kangaroo yes this did happen today! #statenisland #NYPDnews pic.twitter.com/N7V5S6ALhT
— NYPD 121st Precinct (@NYPD121Pct) October 18, 2015
